Categories.value: 6th-century BC pottery in France|Agriculture in art|Ancient Greek agriculture|Ancient Greek pottery in the Cabinet des médailles, Paris|Attic black-figure pottery|CC-Zero|Chiusi Painter|Details of ancient Greek pottery|Fruit harvest by Sileni in ancient Greek pottery|Grapevines in art|Kylix interiors|Kylixes in France|Maenads in ancient Greek pottery|Nymphs and satyrs|Satyrs in ancient Greek pottery|Women at work in art|Women on ancient Greek pottery

ImageDescription.value:
Detail from Attic black-figure cup, or kylix, ca. end of 6th century BCE, by the Chiusi Painter depicting sileni (aka satyrs) and maenads in a grapevine, harvesting grapes into baskets.

The original photo was taken by User:Bibi Saint-Pol, own work, 2007-10-27 and released into the public domain.

This version of the image has been resized for deeper dpi, cropped to focus on the activity, and color corrected and sharpened.

UsageTerms.value: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication
